briefdescription.para: Archives the BPictureButton object into the data message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to archive into.
Also archive the associated BPicture objects.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK if everything went well or an error code otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The object was archived successfully.
Ran out of memory while archiving the object.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to a new BPictureButton object created from the BPictureButton data archived in data.

simplesect.para: A newly created BPictureButton object or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BPictureButton.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the control is attached to a window.

This method overrides BView::AttachedToWindow() setting the low color and view color of the BControl so that it matches the view color of the control's parent view. It also makes the attached window the default target for Invoke() as long as another target has not already been set.
Hook method called when the control is detached from a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.
Hook method called when the view is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame that the view has been moved to.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the view is resized.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the view.
The new height of the view.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the attached window is activated or deactivated.
Redraws the focus ring around the control when the window is activated or deactivated if it is the window's current focus view.

parameterdescription.para: true if the window becomes activated, false if the window becomes deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Draws the BPictureButton from its associated BPicture objects.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method to draw their view.

simplesect.para: This is an hook method called by the Interface Kit, you don't have to call it yourself. If you need to forcefully redraw the view consider calling Invalidate() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangular area to be drawn.

detaileddescription.para: Handle message received by the associated looper.

parameterdescription.para: The message received by the associated looper.

briefdescription.para: Invokes the button on either B_ENTER B_SPACE.

detaileddescription.para: Overrides BView::KeyDown() to toggle the control value and then calls Invoke() for B_SPACE or B_ENTER. If this is not desired you should override this method in derived classes.
The KeyDown() method is only called if the BControl is the focus view in the active window. If the window has a default button, B_ENTER will be passed to that object instead of the focus view.

parameterdescription.para: The bytes of the key combination pressed.
The number of bytes in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Sets the button value based on the buttons Behavior().

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is pressed.

briefdescription.para: Invokes the button.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is released.
The new location of the mouse in the view's coordinate system.

One of the following:
B_ENTERED_VIEW The cursor has just entered the view.
B_INSIDE_VIEW The cursor is inside the view.
B_EXITED_VIEW The cursor has left the view's bounds. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
B_OUTSIDE_VIEW The cursor is outside the view. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
If a drag-and-drop operation is taking place this is a pointer to a BMessage that holds the drag information, otherwise the pointer is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Initializes an BPictureButton object copying the data from from the passed in data archive.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *name, BPicture *off, BPicture *on, BMessage *message, uint32 behavior=B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON, uint32 resizingMode=B_FOLLOW_LEFT_TOP, uint32 flgs=B_WILL_DRAW|B_NAVIGABLE)
memberdef.name: BPictureButton

briefdescription.para: Initializes a new BPictureButton object.

parameterdescription.para: The frame rectangle of the button.
The name of the button used internally.
The BPicture object to use when the object is off.
The BPicture object to use when the object is on.
The BMessage to send when the object is invoked.
Either B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON or B_TWO_STATE_BUTTON.
Defines the view's behavior when its parent is resized, see BView for more details.
The view flags, see BView for more details.

briefdescription.para: Destroys the BPictureButton along with the associated BPicture objects.
Return the currently set behavior.
Returns a pointer to the BPicture object used when the button is disabled and off.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BPicture object or NULL if not set.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the BPicture object used when the button is disabled and on.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BPicture object or NULL if not set.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the BPicture object used when the button is enabled and off.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BPicture object or NULL if not set.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the BPicture object used when the button is enabled and on.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BPicture object or NULL if not set.

detaileddescription.para: Fill out the preferred width and height of the control into the _width and _height parameters.
Derived classes can override this method to set the preferred width and height of the control.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a float to hold the width of the control.
Pointer to a float to hold the height of the control.

detaileddescription.para: Report the suites of messages this control understands.
Adds the string "suite/vnd.Be-control" to the message.
Sends a copy of the model message to the designated target.

BControl::Invoke() overrides BInvoker::Invoke(). Derived classes should use this method in their MouseDown() and KeyDown() methods and should call IsEnabled() to check if the control is enabled before calling Invoke().

The following fields added to the BMessage:
"when" B_INT64_TYPE system_time()
"source" B_POINTER_TYPE A pointer to the BControl object.

parameterdescription.para: The message to send.

simplesect.para: B_OK if the control was invoked, otherwise an error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Gives or removes focus from the control.
BControl::MakeFocus() overrides BView::MakeFocus() to call Draw() when the focus changes. Derived classes generally don't have to re-implement MakeFocus().
IsFocusChanging() returns true when Draw() is called from this method.

parameterdescription.para: true to set focus, false to remove it.

detaileddescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers that derived classes understand.
Resize the control to its preferred size.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 what, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: Set the behavior to either B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON or B_TWO_STATE_BUTTON.

detaileddescription.para: A one-state BPictureButton acts like a normal button, the value is set to B_CONTROL_ON when the button is being pressed and it is set to B_CONTROL_OFF otherwise. A two-state object acts like a checkbox, the value alternates between B_CONTROL_ON and B_CONTROL_OFF each time the user presses and releases the button.

parameterdescription.para: Either B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON or B_TWO_STATE_BUTTON.

briefdescription.para: Sets the BPicture to draw when the button is disabled and off.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BPicture object to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the BPicture to draw when the button is disabled and on.

detaileddescription.para: If the behavior is set to B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON this does not need be set because a disabled one-state control can never be on.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BPicture object to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the BPicture to draw when the button is enabled and off.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BPicture object to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the BPicture to draw when the button is enabled and on.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BPicture object to set.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the value of the control.
If the value changes the control is redrawn.

parameterdescription.para: The value to set.

briefdescription.para: A button draw with a BPicture image instead of a text label.

detaileddescription.para:
There are two types:
B_ONE_STATE_BUTTON Acts like a normal BButton, the value is set to B_CONTROL_ON when the button is being pressed and is set to B_CONTROL_OFF otherwise.
B_TWO_STATE_BUTTON Acts like a checkbox, the value alternates between B_CONTROL_ON and B_CONTROL_OFF each time the user presses and releases the button.
